page.title: 02PALACERIGG :INTERVIEW
page.content: WE INVITED A RANGER CALLED RICHARD TO COME AND TALK TO US ABOUT HIS WORK IN PALACERIGG COUNTRY PARK. HE TOLD US THAT HE STARTS WORK AT 8.30 A.M. EVERY MORNING. AFTER PUTTING HIS BIKE IN THE SHED HE CHECKS TO SEE THAT EVERYTHING IS IN ORDER. WHEN WORKING HE HAS TO WEAR CLOTHES TO PROTECT HIM FROM ALL KINDS OF WEATHER. OUTSIDE RANGERS GET A GRANT FROM THE COUNTRYSIDE COMMISSION OF SCOTLAND TO BUY WHATEVER CLOTHES ARE NEEDED SO LONG AS THEY ARE CAMOUFLAGE COLOURS. HE MUST ALWAYS WEAR HIS RANGER BADGE.HE WORKS TO A TIMETABLE AND A RANGER MUST BE AVAILABLE FOR WORK ANY DAY OF THE YEAR. HIS TIMETABLE INCLUDES SCHOOL VISITS TO TALK ABOUT BIRDS, TREES AND LOCAL HISTORY. HE ALSO DOES GUIDED TOURS AND SLIDE SHOWS. HE ALSO FEEDS AND LOOKS AFTER THE ANIMALS.
